reviewText: Here we are at last, the final installment of the Dallas releases, the tv-movies.  I'll go over them film by film.  First up is the Early Years, a great prequel film from 86 written by series creator David Jacobs.  It is interesting in it's way, although not entirely in sync with the show.  Next is JR Returns, the first reunion sequel.  This is a great film, providing an excellent resolution to the series with a great sense of continuity and finality.  It was written by Dallas masters Leonard Katzman and Art Lewis and directed by Katzman, who died shortly before it's release.  As the main man behind all of Dallas except the dream, it is a fitting tribute to him and Swan Song to his show which he ran and crafted for so long.  The next one, War of the Ewings, is not as good, having a new writer come on and in general being extraneous.  Finally, the silly 04 reunion which was already on another season release is also going to be here.  It's just the cast hanging around as themselves and frankly doesn't do much for me.  Nevertheless, it's all great Dallas and is all wonderful to have together.

reviewText: This DVD collection shows background on how it all started showing when all the original characters were young with old time fashions, ideas and ideals.  The reunion storyline was also on par with everything else that I saw.  It is interesting on how the viewer gets to see how the actors aged and how most of them kept themselves well fit!  Some of them even improved with age! This package is certainly a complement to the rest of the offering!  Some of the characters were sad to see "offed" and some of the others that were evil, in some cases just got in the way.  But that is the magic of how it all was treated!  It is also interesting to see how many of the main actors gave it a shot at directing various series. Good purchase and well worth the moo-la!
summary: Great complement to the 14 Seasons collection!
Title: N/A

reviewText: Dallas, one of the coolest and slickest adult soap operas ended with a bang-literally. For those of you who watched the finale, a gun was fired and only Bobby saw what happened.  Fans (and there are rabid ones out there!) spent years wondering what happened.  And along comes JR Returns.  This was a clever movie that resolved the loose ends from the series.  Dallas War of the Ewings wasn't as bad as some of the reviews would let you believe, but it was not really an auspicious film.  Additional features include Dallas The Early Years, which takes us to the origins of the Barnes/Ewing feud and a nice reunion show.  Be warned, the new Dallas series ignores the events of the movies, but if you like many fans of the original are boycotting the new series you will find some closure and some fun seeing our "heroes" again.
summary: This completes your collection, and provides some closure to original series!

reviewText: I Didn't Know This Collection Was Available Until It Was Offered To Me Thru Amazon. I Almost Bought It During This Past Christmas Season, But A Prior Rather Large Purchase Was Pending. I'm Getting So Many Mixed Reviews To The Point Of Confusions. I Am Aware Of A Book Which Also Goes Behind The Scenes And Discusses All Of The Characters And Has Great Trivia, All You Ever Wanted To Know About "Dallas" Type Fun Info But Were Afraid To Ask. I'm Considering Buying That Too. I'm Sure This Collection Will Be A Great Add On To Everyone Who Are Collecting Or Has Collected The "Dallas" Series. Or To Everyone Who Just Like TV Type Dramatic Movies. I Like Prequels And I Like Reunion Type Movies Too. Since "Dynasty" Has Been So Slow In Being Released, I've Become A Returned to "Dallas" fan. After Buying A Used Copy Of Season 3, I Decided To Go Back And Purchase Seasons 1&2. Since Then I've Purchased Seasons 4-7, With Having Just Purchased 5-7 This Morning. I Noticed That Someone Suggested That The Entire Series Should Be Viewed Before Viewing The Movies. It Does Make Sense, Because If You Don't Know Who The Character Were/Are, You'll Wind Up Asking Thousands Of Questions About The Characters Which Are Mostly Answered In The Series. At This Moment My Decision Is Out To Lunch on When I May Purchase This Collection. My Thought Is To Purchase Season 8-11. And Then Later Purchase Seasons 12-14 And This Collection. My Projection Is To Complete My Collection Within About A Year And A Half. I Could Only Give This Collection Three Stars Because I Haven't Viewed The Movies.  I'm Sure They're Excellent. And I Hope That We, The Fans, Are Not Disappointed About "The New Dallas Series" That Is Due To Begin Airing This Summer.

reviewText: I am so glad these movies are finally coming out.  I've been looking for The Early Years all over the place.  It's hard to come by.  Got a hold of a poorly reproduced copy of JR Returns.  It'll do until this new DVD comes out.  Hopefully it'll be good quality.  They should also include The Ewing Bloopers.  I bought that from someone online a few years ago, but again it's a poor quality DVD.  Hilarious to watch though.  Some bloopers are included with the reunion special, but The Ewing Bloopers in uncensored and includes a lot more.  I was a huge Dallas fan, just twelve years old when it started.  Watched it all the way through.  I love the cast as if they were my own family, and watching the reunion and the Bloopers gives you a feel for who these people are in real life, not just on-screen.

reviewText: Having watched all 14 seasons & the new TNT reboot of "Dallas", I have to say that this is a beginning & end to the original series, "The Early Years" gives us Dale Midkiff as a young Jock Ewing & Molly Hagan as a young Miss Elle, Hagan definately has the face of what Miss Elle might have looked like in her youth, the actor that plays the younger Digger Barnes definately favors Ken Kercheval who played Cliff Barnes, they definately picked the right actors to portray these beloved characters in their youth, we also meet Jock Ewing's brother Jason who's children we met in season 8 & 9 that was played by Jennilee Harrison & Dack Rambo, when Jock, Jason, & Digger do hit oil they deal with all kinds of corruption from the local towns people as they try to strike oil in the depression era Texas of the 1930's, we see what led to Jock & Jason's falling out as it was talked about in season 8, we also see what brought about Jock & Digger's feud that would carry on with their children J.R. & Cliff in the series, this is a great prequel film & should be watched before the series to newcomers who watch for the first time, my only complaint on this one is Jock & Elle's courtship is a bit rushed, but other than that, a good set-up to the series, the second film "J.R. Returns" picks up where season 14 ended, with J.R. once again having lost everthing at the end of the series trying to get Ewing Oil back, what I liked about this one is that it really sets-up the new series now airing on TNT, with a teenage John Ross & Christopher & Cliff's teenage daughter, who are in their 30's with the new show & Bobby's new girlfriend who looks like a younger version of Brenda Strong who is Bobby's new wife on the current TNT reboot, which brings me to the last made-for-T.V.-movie "War of the Ewings" which totally contradicts the show, whoever wrote this one wasn't a true fan or even a good writer, where do I start, this one totally ignores the events in "J.R. Returns", there is no John Ross, Christopher, Cliff Barnes, all are MIA, it is as if they never existed,  Bobby's new girlfriend is never mentioned, there is an implied romance betwwen Bobby & Sue Ellen(dumb) an assassination attempt on J.R. that makes no sense, he hasn't done anything at this point to warrant such an attempt, this was said to be a ratings disappointment & I can see why, why Patrick Duffy, Linda Gray, & Larry Hagman agreed to this script is a mystery, for new fans I say watch the Prequel film "Early Years", the 14 seasons, then "J.R. Returns" & go directly to the new TNT rebooted "Dallas", but skip "War of the Ewings" at all costs.
summary: "The Early Years & J.R. Returns" are good,.....War of the Ewings" terrible!!

reviewText: If you have purchased the entire series of "Dallas" on DVD your collection will not be complete without this fantastic collection of "Dallas" amde-for-TV movies. On this two-disc set viewers get the three films including the prequel that aired on CBS in 1986 while the series was still airing called "The Early Years" which shows the beginnings of Southfork and how the Ewing/Barnes feud began. The last two movies aired after the serial went off the aired and the first "J.R. Returns" aired in 1996 and was quite a ratings bonanza. It featured Larry Hagman , Patrick Duffy and Linda Grey reprising their roles and showed the stronger side of Sue Ellen who was no longer an alcoholic, but a very demanding and conniving business woman. The final film "The War of the Ewings" was not at all well-written mainly because the powers-that-be who helmed the first "Dallas" sequel were not on board, and ultimately it was a ratings failure. This led CBS to cancel any future productions of "Dallas" movies.However, with the return of "Dallas" in the summer of 2012 on cable's TNT as a weekly series there will be renewed interest in the original series.

reviewText: I will disagree with the previous reviewer and i will say the right thing is to begin with the EARLY YEARS and then to go through the entire 14 seasons before to go to the two re-union films. this is the right order.Anyways...it's great to have the entire series completed with the tv movies and it's also great to have the 2004 reunion which may not be a movie but still it's great to see the old gang together again in the house they lived for nearly 15 years or so talking and remembering their past. For example it's great to see vintoria complaining to patrick about their divorce and patrick's involvement with the beautiful priscilla presley and now u can cry and weep about how great were romeo and juliet in the show but for me patrick and priscilla had a great erotic chemistry which is impossible to understand unless u watch the entire 6th dvd show to see it for yourself.Anyways this is a great but not complete set cause recently another reunion was releaseed and u can order this gem from the official dallas website.I Think this new reunion is from 2008 or so. the previous 2004 reunion is also available in the season 4 dvd set.
summary: Now we can complete our dallas collection ? well...almost
